activities: Actavis plc. receives a variety of types of personal data from its subsidiaries, affiliates, agents and third parties in the EU, EEA and Switzerland consisting of electronic and hard copy personal and sensitive data embodied in (i) correspondence, (ii) documents for conducting business and research, (iii) human resources data, and (iv) adverse event reports collected and processed within the context of Actavis' Pharmacovigilance operations. These data are collected and transferred to the US in support of the company's employment, research, development, regulatory, marketing, sales, financial, legal and other commercial and business activities and operations.
address: Morris Corporate Center III, 400 Interpace Parkway
eucountries: Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Cyprus, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Liechtenstein, Lithuania, Luxembourg, Malta, Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, United Kingdom
personaldata: Human resources data, Off-line, On-Line, Manually processed data and Pharmacovigilance related data
recoursemech: EU data protection authorities (DPAs) and Swiss Federal Data Protection and Information Commissioner (FDPIC).
